 Has anyone been following this story? Basically, Bush and the Pentagon got together decided that countries that did not support or back the US in the war in Iraq may not share in the profits of rebuilding the country. 
 France, Germany, Canada, and Russia were all included by Bush in this group. Following the announcement, these countries among others stated that this was unfair, France even going as far as to say it is a "clear violation of international law". Some countries have threatened economic ramifications for the US if this policy does not change. The 60+ countries that supported the US will receive shares of the 18 billion dollars worth of contracts. This 18 billion dollars comes from American taxpayer pockets. 
 
 Personally, I think France and others have no right to complain. These countries were very vocal in the fact that they did not support the coalition in Iraq, but they now want to benefit economically from the rebuilding contracts. Bush has even called these countries to ask them to forgive Iraq's debt to them, however they all refuse to do so. It seems to me that if these countries had any interest in helping Iraq get back on it's feet and established as a respectable country, they would forgive these debts as a show of good will. Their refusal to help Iraq shows that they are only interested in putting money into their own economy, at the expense of the American taxpayer.
